A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
[For those in a hurry: Please see this incredible movie now.]

The Last Jedi has gone back to  what heroism is about: breaking self-fulfilling prophecies and defining your own destiny. They threw out the tedious tropes about "the chosen one" and pissed on cliched internet theories. Instead they have made an original film that has created new territory for every movie that will follow it.  

Most of these 1/2 or 1 star reviews are from fans who went into the theater expecting nostalgia but instead they learned that their childhood is over and that this is the year 2017. Of course they split hairs and justify their bias using plot holes as a excuse for their disappointment\, but make no mistake\, they simply cannot except change and wish to watch the same formulaic drivel over and over again\, in a new skin.

P.S. this movie is especially rewarding for people who understand symbolism and seek a deeper message when they watch a film.
